definition.title: What is Laparoscopic Hernia Surgery?
definition.content: Laparoscopic hernia surgery, also known as keyhole hernia repair, is a minimally invasive surgical procedure used to repair a hernia, which occurs when an organ or fatty tissue pushes through a weak spot in the surrounding muscle or connective tissue.

symptoms.title: Symptoms of a Hernia
listItems: Weakness or pressure in the affected area
Nausea or vomiting in bowel obstruction

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Hernia repair is typically carried out through surgery. There are two main types of hernia surgery: traditional open hernia repair and laparoscopic hernia repair. The latter involves smaller incisions, faster recovery, and less postoperative pain.

prevention.title: Post-operative Care
listItems: Report any complications to your doctor
